DOCNAME: CASE OF ARSLAN AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression-{general} (Article 10-1 - Freedom of expression)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . Mr NORP lives in GPE . The other applicants live in LOC . According to the applicants’ submissions , which were not contested by the Government , at the time of the lodging of the application , they were serving the prison sentences arising out of their criminal convictions which gave rise to the present application .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE CARDINAL members of ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) , an illegal organisation , were killed in a rural area within the administrative jurisdiction of the town of GPE , near the city of GPE , by members of the security forces .

CARDINAL . On DATE a gathering was held in protest at the alleged unlawful killings of CARDINAL and DATE in GPE . University students from ORG , including the applicants , gathered in front of the building of LOC ve PERSON ) where a press statement was read out .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL of the applicants , PERSON , attended another reading out of a press statement in GPE . The press statement concerned the killings of CARDINAL and DATE , the arrest of a number of persons subsequent to the reading out of the press statement on DATE and the alleged unlawful killing of a detainee by the police .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE public prosecutor initiated criminal proceedings against CARDINAL people , including the applicants , charging them with disseminating propaganda in favour of the ORG , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG ( Law no . ORG ) . According to the indictment , during the gathering of DATE , slogans such as “ Long live revolutionary solidarity ” ( “ NORP devrimci dayanışma ” ) , “ We have paid a price . We will make them pay a price . ” ( “ Bedel ödedik , bedel ödeteceğiz . ” ) , “ ORG ” ( “ QUANTITY ” ) , “ NORP martyrs are immortal ” ( “ Devrim şehitleri ölümsüzdür . ” ) , “ Martyrs are immortal ” ( “ ORG namırın ” ) , were chanted and the applicants participated in the gathering . The public prosecutor further noted that ORG had participated in the gathering of DATE , during which the following slogans had been chanted : “ No emancipation alone , either all of us or none of us . ” ( “ GPE yok tek başına , ya hep beraber ya hiçbirimiz . ) ” , “ Arrests , provocations and coercion can not discourage us . ” ( “ PERSON , provakasyonlar , baskılar bizi yıldıramaz . ” ) , “ We will resist and succeed ” ( “ GPE direne kazanacağız . ” ) , “ We have paid a price ; we will make them pay a price . ” “ Bedel ödedik , bedel ödeteceğiz ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the applicants guilty as charged and sentenced each of them to QUANTITY months’ imprisonment pursuant to section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of PERSON no . ORG , except for PERSON , who was sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . As regards the gathering of DATE , the assize court found it established that the slogan “ Martyrs are immortal ” had been chanted by PERSON , PERSON , PERSON PERSON and PERSON and that the slogans “ The murderer state will pay the price ” , “ NORP martyrs are immortal ” and “ Long live revolutionary solidarity ” had been chanted by PERSON Yaşar Çalışkan , Mr PERSON and PERSON . The court also found it established that all the applicants except for PERSON Olcay ORG had chanted the slogan “ We have paid a price ; we will make them pay a price ” and that PERSON had carried a banner bearing the slogan “ ORG are immortal ” . As regards the gathering of DATE , the court noted that ORG had chanted the slogans “ Arrests , provocations and coercion can not discourage us . ” , “ We will resist and succeed ” and “ We have paid a price ; we will make them pay a price . ” during that public gathering .

CARDINAL . In its judgment , ORG referred to LAW as well as to the ORG ’s judgment in the case of NORP v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL ) ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALIV ) and the report of ORG in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . ORG report of DATE ) . The court held that by chanting the above - mentioned slogans the applicants had not exercised their democratic rights but had glorified terror by adopting the style of discourse of terror organisations and that they had not distanced themselves from violence . In the court ’s view , by chanting those slogans the applicants had not intended to find a solution to a problem but had praised and glorified the source of the problem , that is to say , the terrorist organisations concerned . Hence , the applicants had incited terror . ORG concluded that chanting the slogans in question could not be considered as falling within the scope of the right to freedom of expression .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE in so far as it concerned the applicants’ conviction .
CARDINAL . On unspecified dates the applicants served their prison sentences .
